result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J. Kolbo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas J. Kolbo is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas J. Kolbo was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Nicholas J. Kolbo was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription as approved by agent.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Alcohol / drug,  DV Counseling (26 week course),  Psychiatric/psychological.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $  TBD   plus surcharges.
*   State shall have 60 days to determine.
May not have contact with Daniel R, Crystal A, Keely E K, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Defendant Nicholas J. Kolbo appeared with Attorney Denise s Hertz-Mcgrath. Defendant in custody. Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution. Court reporter Jane Slaght. Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: 14CF331 & 14CF1495. Discussion held regarding PSI - The Court called P&P but the agent who prepared the report was unavailable, spoke with Supervisor Schubert regarding the issues with the PSI. Matter adjourned so that Agent Pounders can be available by phone if necessary and so that Atty Hertz-McGrath may attempt to obtain confidential Racine files. Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State in victim compliance.  On State's motion, cts 2, 4, 5 & 6 are dismissed and read in; cts 7, 8 & 9 are dismissed.  State amends criminal complaint in that the conviction date for file 09CF1694 was 7/7/10.  Deft pleads no contest to cts 1 & 3.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 3.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 7/17/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.
